article.headline: Pacific 74, Long Beach St. 52
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. -- Pat Eveland scored a career-high 23 points, and Pacific used a late surge to run away from Long Beach State 74-52 on Wednesday night. Eveland went 9 of 10 from the field, including 5 of 5 from 3-point range. Sam Willard added 16 points for the Tigers (17-8, 9-3 Big West), who hit 10 of 19 3-pointers and won their second in a row. Eugene Phelps scored 13 points and T.J. Robinson had 11 to lead the 49ers (12-14, 6-7), who lost their second straight game. With the Tigers leading 42-40, Eveland scored and then Willard hit six in a row for a 50-40 edge with 11:30 left. Pacific later used a 10-0 run to turn a 59-50 lead into a 69-50 advantage with 4:36 left, icing the game. The Tigers, who held a 35-28 rebounding advantage, led 33-26 at intermission.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
